You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE ORDER MANAGEMENT
Order Delivery Method Fields

The Order Delivery Method object is used together with the Product object to represent a delivery method. The product record is added to an order to represent a charge for that delivery method.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
NOTE Depending on your page layout and field-level security settings, some fields aren’t visible or editable.

This table lists the fields on the Order Delivery Method object.

FIELD LABEL	DESCRIPTION
Carrier	The carrier that the customer chose for the delivery.
Class of Service	The carrier class of service that the customer chose for the delivery.
Created By	The user who created the order delivery method record.
Created Date	The date when the order delivery method record was created.
Description	The description of the order delivery method.
Is Active	Indicates whether the order delivery method is active.
Last Modified By	The user who last changed the order delivery method record.
Last Modified Dare	The date when the order delivery method record was last changed.
Name	The name of the order delivery method.
Product	

The product that represents a delivery charge order product for a delivery using this order delivery method.

For example, you can create a product that represents an overnight express charge and assign it to an overnight express order delivery method.


Reference Number	The reference number for an external order delivery method.

title: Understanding Order Delivery Methods in Salesforce
